Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (7/5/2012 6:16:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Wizards is making a statement, they dont want pure LD decks to win games. This is a pure sideboard card, when budget players need an answer to powerful non basics.   
  
[Demolish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demolish) is more likely to be maindecked, and more likely running into the situation where your stuck at 3 lands to have one of them demolished, completely spoiling your game!  
  
Still that does not explain [Bramblecrush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bramblecrush), or [Melt Terrain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Melt Terrain), and the fact that Demolish is in standard... Well I tried guys, maybe wizards just wanted a filler card that was worse then everything to take up space in your booster packs??
posts.html:
Wizards is making a statement, they dont want pure LD decks to win games. This is a pure sideboard card, when budget players need an answer to powerful non basics.

Demolish is more likely to be maindecked, and more likely running into the situation where your stuck at 3 lands to have one of them demolished, completely spoiling your game!

Still that does not explain Bramblecrush, or Melt Terrain, and the fact that Demolish is in standard... Well I tried guys, maybe wizards just wanted a filler card that was worse then everything to take up space in your booster packs??

Posted By: Frozenwings (7/9/2012 3:51:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Because [Demolish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demolish), which you reprinted in the previous block, was far, FAR too powerful. Of course.  
  
I'm fine with LD never being below 4 cmc so long as you make it INTERESTING. I'm perfectly willing to admit that [Stone Rain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stone Rain) is too powerful, that's fine by me. I'm perfectly willing to admit that [Pillage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pillage) was broken as all hell, I'm with you there. But printing blatantly shit cards? Just...no. Don't do it. It never goes down well with anyone, has never prevented power creep, and just leaves a sour taste in everyone's mouths. You're cutting down trees for your arrogance, guys. Making cards no one will ever play does not improve the game ever. For any reason.
posts.html:
Because Demolish, which you reprinted in the previous block, was far, FAR too powerful. Of course.

I'm fine with LD never being below 4 cmc so long as you make it INTERESTING. I'm perfectly willing to admit that Stone Rain is too powerful, that's fine by me. I'm perfectly willing to admit that Pillage was broken as all hell, I'm with you there. But printing blatantly shit cards? Just...no. Don't do it. It never goes down well with anyone, has never prevented power creep, and just leaves a sour taste in everyone's mouths. You're cutting down trees for your arrogance, guys. posts.post_content:
This card is not amazing but it also isn't worth 0.5 stars.  
  
It's decent LD, and I think it's pretty notable with Cavern of Souls still in standard (although there is still better LD.)  
  
Just because there's better of something doesn't mean that it can't be good.  
  
Every creature in magic isn't bad because [Emrakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul) exists.  
  
Every planeswalker isn't bad because [Jace the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace the Mind Sculptor) exists.  
  
Every counterspell isn't bad because [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) exists.  
  
Every burn spell isn't bad because [Bonfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonfire) exists.  
  
I like the flavor text, too.
posts.html:
This card is not amazing but it also isn't worth 0.5 stars.

It's decent LD, and I think it's pretty notable with Cavern of Souls still in standard (although there is still better LD.)

Just because there's better of something doesn't mean that it can't be good.

Every creature in magic isn't bad because Emrakul exists.

Every planeswalker isn't bad because Jace the Mind Sculptor exists.

posts.post_content:
I think this is quite funny!  
  
I think they are trying to compensate for the shuffler mana screws in MTGO. Oh you are running 23 land in your 60 card deck? Lets give you 1 land in your opening hand (with all the best cards in your deck cc 3 or higher), none in your first mulligan, 1 in your second mulligan (with none of the cards you need) and then just for fun we will give you 3 land in your final mulligan (out of your remaining 4 cards and the remaining card will be a llanowar elf or something equally as exciting with no other playables in hand).   
  
Should have kept your first hand and took a chance huh? You knew that the lowest land destruction was 4 casting cost. What were you thinking? haha
